title: SASL error
content: Thunderbird couldn't connect to ATT/yahoo mail with the error "Sending of username did not succeed. Mail server inbound.att.net responded: Unsupported SASL mechanism." I am totally unfamiliar with this issue but know it involves an encrypted password. A net search so far is of little help though I did run into a statement that windows doesn't have this issue. I use linux and searching my package manager I find quite a few SASL mechanism plugins (who knew?) but no way to differentiate any. ATT's site is useless. Is anyone here familiar with this problem? In the meantime, I see 1 called login mechanism plugin - no, thats deprecated of course, says use the plain one so its that one for me. Tnx...
creator: jeff-g

title: Transfer Thunderbird to new PC
content: I am about to change desktop computers - upgrading to Windows 11. How or can I transfer all my Thunderbird data, saved emails, address books,layout, etc, to my new computer? Can I export everything to an external hard drive and then import to the new PC? Many thanks for any advice. heers, Ron
creator: rong1.6018

title: ik kan geen emails meer verzenden

title: Cartelle Thunderbird in inglese
content:
Buongiorno, sto utilizzando Thunderbird Mobile sul mio Android e ho configurato 3 mailbox:

@libero.it @live.it @miasocietà.it (per intenderci un indirizzo Microsoft 365)

Libero e Live mostrano cartelle in inglese come Sent, Trash, Deleted etc tranne che per Posta in arrivo. L'unica totalmente in italiano è quella con indirizzo su 365.

Potreste aiutarmi e configurare la cartelle su libero e live in italiano?

Grazie a tutti per il supporto
creator: Greekgod1988

title: I'd like to type "rgd" enter and get "regards" instead , for example
content: In microsoft word i have a number of abbrevs that i created (mostly in french, my language) such as bmbm : Bonjour Monsieur, Bonjour Madame, bcdt : bien cordialement mda : merci d'avance etc... there is'nt that many entries so i dont really need to IMPORT (which i have been trying for hours) , i'd be happy to enter them manually again in Thunderbird (im using version nr 91 at mom) but i cannot find out HOW ? tks for your help !
creator: gregoire.quenot
